sentences.english: The clamour of the heavy traffic gave you a headache.
sentences.chinese: 来往车辆嘈杂的声浪使人头痛。

sentences.english: But criticism of the entire phenomenon is growing as well.
sentences.chinese: 但针对这个现象的批评声浪也在增加。

sentences.english: Musharraf has unilaterally amended the constitution at the beginning of the week and caused strong objections and noises.
sentences.chinese: 穆夏拉夫本周初片面修改宪法，掀起极大的反弹声浪。

sentences.english: All about us is noise and bramble.
sentences.chinese: 我们的周遭都是荆棘与嘈杂声浪。

sentences.english: Until recent years, the government cracked down on any critics of the dam.
sentences.chinese: 直到近些年，政府才将对大坝的批评声浪压制下去。

sentences.english: On rainy days ，Swimming in the sound.
sentences.chinese: 在雨天，我们在声浪中游泳。

sentences.english: The voice of Huo mulberry is deep and low and vibrates, eyes are like to brightly shiningly have fire.
sentences.chinese: 霍桑的声浪低沉而颤动，眼睛也像灼灼地有火。

sentences.english: But as the decision to strike drags on, anti-war voices begin to grow louder.
sentences.chinese: 攻击行动拖宕日久，国内反战的声浪渐渐大了起来。

definition: loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
a shout/fig. opinion or demand, esp. expressed by a group
